citation.article-title: Phenotypic and phylogenetic characterization of some Gemella-like organisms from human infections: description of Dolosigranulum pigrum gen. nov., sp. nov.

p.s: Dolosigranulum (Do. lo. si. gra'nu.lum, L. adj. dolosus crafty, deceitful; L. neu. n. granulum a small grain; N. L. neu. n. Dolosigranulum: a deceptive small grain)
Cells are Gram-positive, ovoid, occurring in pairs or groups.
Growth occurs on 5% horse blood agar, producing a weak α-haemolytic reaction.
Growth does not occur in 6.5% NaCl, 40% bile aesculin, or at 10 or 45°C.
Acid is produced from D-glucose and some other sugars.
Pyrrolidonylarylamidase, leucine arylarnidase and arginine dehydrogenase are produced.
Cell wall murein is based upon L-Lysine (type LYS-D-ASP).
The G + C content is 40.5 mol%.
The type species is Dolosigranulum pigrum.
